candidates.name: Stephanie (Steve) Anne Chadwick
candidates.why_elect: I have a track record, I know how government works as a previous Cabinet Minister. I get things done and stick with a Vision set by our community. I love our place, people and culture and together we are achieving great things for our District. Partnerships are key.
candidates.why_stand: I want to finish the projects underway through partnership with Government, iwi and other funders. I have lead a great team and there is more to do together. We have restored a belief in ourselves and our community is thriving. We have a plan. Tatau Tatau.

candidates.name: Dennis Curtis
candidates.why_elect: I believe in balance, opportunity, growth and drive I care about all communities and their voice and not the singular, committing and promising protection, sustainability and equality a Rotorua lad with executive international business experience leading iwi organisations, trusts and incorporations. I will not promise what cannot be delivered.
candidates.why_stand: I stand for basic fundamentals. I believe that these three principles are what will drive the change we need in Rotorua: protection, sustainability, and equality.

candidates.name: Reynold Macpherson
candidates.why_elect: I have international, research-based and practical leadership experience in turning around large organisations and systems by reforming governance and corporate management services. If elected, I will help residents, ratepayers and working families prosper, listen to everyone, including advice from Te Arawa, Rural and Lakes policy advisory boards and expert officials.
candidates.why_stand: Like others endorsed by Residents and Ratepayers, I want to make Rotorua a better place for everyone.
